results.title: Mikhail Kaufman in Dziga Vertov’s Chelovek s kinoapparatom (Man with a Movie Camera)
results.brief_description: Dziga Vertov’s kino-pravda (“film truth”) concept was premised on the camera’s ability to reveal truth. It inspired both cinéma vérité and direct cinema, which informed Albert and David Maysles’ intimate ‘fly-on-the-wall’ style and Agnès Varda’s intimate portraits of society and herself.
results.title_for_label: Mikhail Kaufman in Dziga Vertov’s Chelovek s kinoapparatom (Man with a Movie Camera)
results.description: Documentarians develop camera techniques to access, interpret and compose notions of truth. Dziga Vertov’s kino-pravda (“film truth”) concept was premised on the camera’s ability to reveal truth. In the 1960s, it inspired the development of both cinéma vérité (“truthful cinema”) and direct cinema, which informed Albert and David Maysles’ intimate ‘fly-on-the-wall’ style and Agnès Varda’s use of a handheld camera to create a portrait of society and herself.
description_for_label: Documentarians develop camera techniques to access, interpret and compose notions of truth. Dziga Vertov’s kino-pravda (“film truth”) concept was premised on the camera’s ability to reveal truth. In the 1960s, it inspired the development of both cinéma vérité (“truthful cinema”) and direct cinema, which informed Albert and David Maysles’ intimate ‘fly-on-the-wall’ style and Agnès Varda’s use of a handheld camera to create a portrait of society and herself.

results.title: Air!
results.creator_credit: Paul Driessen, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This animated short makes the point that oxygen is the stuff of life whether on land, in the air or water, but that it is becoming scarcer as man-made pollutants crowd it out. It is a film without words in which plants, birds, fish and, finally, man come to the same ‘breathless’ end. (Awards: San Francisco, Belgrade)

results.title: Akira [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Katsuhiro Otomo, Ryohei Suzuki, Shunzo Kato and Akira Committee
results.brief_description: Akira is set in Neo-Tokyo, 2019. The city is rebuilding after World War III. Kaneda and Tetsuo, two high-school dropouts, are members of a joy-riding motorcycle gang. They stumble upon a secret government project to develop telekinetic humans, apparently for use as weapons. The most powerful of these subjects is Akira, a being shrouded in mystery. The film is based on the popular graphic novel of the same name, which has achieved cult status in Japan. Animation and visual effects are outstanding in this spectacular and often disturbing vision of urban apocalypse. NB: THIS IS NOT A CHILDRENS’ FEATURE AND IS RECOMMENDED FOR MATURE AUDIENCES.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 1
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Fox and the crow ; The Goose and the golden eggs ; The Ant and the grasshopper ; The Lion and the mouse ; The Horse and the laden donkey ; The Lion and the bulls and The Vain crow.

results.title: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Rieta Oord and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Dubbed “America’s first female serial killer”, prostitute Aileen Wuornos killed seven men between 1990-91. While she claims self-defence and then is later persuaded by her “supporters” to change her plea, Broomfield skillfully reveals the layers of truth that surround the case. By implication, Broomfield disarmingly and ironically identifies himself as one of those attempting to gain from the “Wuornos Industry”.
results.title_for_label: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer

results.title: Aids: what everyone needs to know [Revised] (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An authoritative exploration of AIDS produced in cooperation with the UCLA AIDS Centre. Discusses symptoms, transmission, diagnosis, how the body becomes prone to other diseases and the increasing danger to the general population. A family in which the husband has AIDS share their feelings.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Intermediate
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: The 30 minute Intermediate program has a more rigorous pace, and the exercises used are more demanding with fewer repetitions. The tape requires a good basic level of fitness, and assumes a level of flexibility and co-ordination such as would be developed through a consistent use of the Beginners Program. For many exercisers, and for elderly exercisers in particular, the intermediate program may be as far as they wish to go. Rated: G

results.title: Aids: not adults only
results.creator_credit: Cristina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Four teenagers explore issues surrounding AIDS in frank and informative interviews with counsellors, other teenagers and a 19 year old who contracted the virus. Discusses how AIDS affects the current generation and challenges common misconceptions about the disease. The theme is prevention while simultaneously providing an opportunity for adolescents to review their attitudes and behaviour.
